data.title: Wonderful coffee house and with a real Seattle feel
data.text: Eclectic environment, homemade bakery and sandwiches. Very relaxing place to work or do internet surfing. They have live music every week. It looks good but but I've not been there for the music.

data.title: Great local cafe and music bar!
data.text: We love coming here at all different times of the day!  Breakfast options are great - scones, biscuit sandwiches, muffins, yogurt/homemade granola/fresh fruit...and probably more that I can think of right now.  They have an assortment of teas and coffees.   I must say I get the yogurt/granola and fresh fruit most often when I go, but their muffins are enormous and delicious!!!  They have bands come in to play a number of nights during the week as well as have open mic nights.

data.title: Nice neighborhood feeling.
data.text: We are here for breakfast. Cute "artsy" place. A lot of people with lap tops, one guy was helping a number of students with something. Food was continental type items, muffins etc. I had an egg sandwich why I think was done in the microwave but can't say for sure.

data.title: My new coffee shop!
data.text: I have passed by this place many times and finally decided to stop. I am so glad I did! Great baked goods, breakfast items, smoothies, and coffee. Everything looked fresh and delicious. There are plenty of tables and chairs and is bigger than it looks. I will definitely be going back to try the spinach pie. Best Bloody Mary I have had in a long time!

data.title: A Nice Place to Spend the Afternoon with Friends or Alone
data.text: This place has good food and good drinks.  It's a nice place to hang out with friends for an extended time as staff does not rush you or pressure you to hurry up.  I went with friends, but I noticed a lot of people alone working on laptops and they seemed content as well.

data.title: Truth in advertising.
data.text: "Riverwalk Cafe & Music Bar" If you want to listen to loud music while having an otherwise quality breakfast, this may be your place. Personally I don't need loud music with my coffee. Tried it three times because the food was good, but the music is way too loud.

data.title: Great spot
data.text: Just discovered this funky spot  in Nashua.   Great place to hang with friends, delicious breakfast sandwich and coffee just great.   Must visit!

data.title: Espresso of choice
data.text: I've been here many times, and the coffee drinks never disappoint; this is my go-to place for espresso creations. The atmosphere is like an old-school inner-city coffee joint or jazz club, and the folks who hang out here are trendy and hip.

data.title: Magnetic Atmosphere!
data.text: What a fun place! I stopped by here on a Sunday afternoon just looking for a quick bite. I had heard and read many great reviews about Riverwalk, but I had never had the chance to drop in. Although it loses a point for horrible parking, everything else about the place is dynamic. The atmosphere makes you want to come back. Live music nightly, friendly staff, tasty food entrees, and a extremely hip decor. I will definitly be returning here. Did I mention free wifi? Incredible place to kick back, relax, decompress and enjoy some food and music.

data.title: Great Place in Nashua
data.text: Riverwalk is a great place to visited in downtown Nashua. Have only had baked goods, which did not disappoint. Coffee beverages are great and prepared quickly. They do offer other food items which I am looking forward to trying. This is a go to place when meeting up with friends to catch up. Recently became aware of the entertainment they offer at night. Will definitely be checking it out. If you like to frequent small businesses & want a change from Starbucks, you should go to Riverwalk.

data.title: Great place to work and eat!
data.text: I visit the Riverwalk Cafe around 2 to 3 times a week and am consistently impressed by both the quality of food and the endless amount of work spaces available. On my first visit I tried their vegan sandwich and lemonade, both of which were delicious. The WiFi here is excellent and the cafe is large enough that you can find a spot near an outlet with relative ease. If you're in Nashua, I definitely recommend visiting Riverwalk for a quick lunch and/or if you want to get some work done in a relaxing environment.

data.title: Incredibly Flavorful & Great Service
data.text:
I highly recommend the Gump Pizza, if you're a fan of seafood, butter, and garlic. It packs a seriously tasty flavor punch. There were some unexpected (and strong) red pepper flakes that caught my fiancé (who doesn't like spicy things) off guard, but I loved it. I can also recommend their cherry pop cocktail for those who like girly flavored drinks that pack a punch. 

It was a great experience. Have a drink, dinner, and take a walk around the area afterward. It'll make for a wonderful evening out.

data.title: Love this place..
data.text: Whether it's for school, work or a couple of drinks during a night out, I have been coming here for years and will continue to do so... 😌

data.title: Fantastic music bar
data.text: This is what Nashua needs in all the restaurants. There is anot her little spot on Pearl St. that offers music while dining. I find it so soothing when the music is just in the back ground. The only thing this place needs is a better menu, though it continues to improve. I highly recommend stopping in.

data.title: Service
data.text:
The location was great.  We were looking for a place to relax, have a snack and drink.  This was the place.  Loved the decor and the wool painting on the walls.
The people working here did a good job of making us feel welcome.

data.title: Very active and "happening" place!
data.text: While the food was good, it was the atmosphere and the various spaces to sit that provided a great experience.  Great coffee drinks, full bar, and entertainment opportunities in a casual and hip atmosphere.  Order at counter, meal delivered to your table.  Enjoyed a great salad and a decadent latte.

data.title: Good, fresh breakfast options
data.text: This was a good place for breakfast. The biscuit sandwich with bacon, egg and cheese was delicious. The coffee is roasted onsite. We were here on a weekday morning so the cafe was not crowded. There is free internet.  They were roasting coffee while I was here which provided pleasant aromas.

data.title: Great coffee and views of the city
data.text: The cappuccino at this place is really good.  It has a nice but limited selection of pastries, good sandwiches, and great views of North Main Street.  It's quaint and feels a bit European.  It's too bad they don't have a larger selection of pastries, though.

data.title: Fun place for some evening music
data.text: Came here for some music and dinner just after Christmas.  Quaint coffee shop in the center of Nashua. While waiting for the jazz group we had dinner. Menu is limited and we decided to order multiple appetizers and a bottle of wine. No complaints at all. Food and wine was good and so was the service. We also  tried a couple of cocktails which were also good. The band was great.The scene is very intimate and we thoroughly enjoyed our visit. We'll return

data.title: Excellent coffee and veggie wrap
data.text:
Stopped in while on business in the area.  The coffee was very good.  The service was ambivalent but I didn't care as long as my Oder was correct.  Options for vegetarians, vegans and meat-eaters alike.  Seemed to be a great spot to meet and hang out. 
Prices were a touch high IMO; but not enough to deter me from stopping in again.
